CWE-20.name: Improper Input Validation
CWE-20.description: Improper Input Validation: A weakness that allows attackers to manipulate the system.
CWE-20.extended_description: This weakness describes a flaw in how the system handles improper input validation. Attackers can exploit this to gain unauthorized access or manipulate data. It affects Node.js, C++ applications running on iOS.

CWE-77.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command
CWE-77.description: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command: A weakness that allows attackers to access the system.
CWE-77.extended_description: This weakness describes a flaw in how the system handles improper neutralization of special elements used in a command. Attackers can exploit this to gain unauthorized access or manipulate data. It affects PHP, C# applications running on Android, Embedded.

CWE-78.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command
CWE-78.description: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command: A weakness that allows attackers to bypass the system.
CWE-78.extended_description: This weakness describes a flaw in how the system handles improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command. Attackers can exploit this to gain unauthorized access or manipulate data. It affects OpenSSL applications running on Cloud.

CWE-79.name: Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
CWE-79.description: Cross-site Scripting (XSS): A weakness that allows attackers to bypass the system.
CWE-79.extended_description: This weakness describes a flaw in how the system handles cross-site scripting (xss). Attackers can exploit this to gain unauthorized access or manipulate data. It affects SQL, Azure applications running on Embedded, Web.
